post.regular-body:
Racked to secondary for 4 months of aging. Tastes good.

FG=1.017

post.photo-caption: Like #006, there’s still slow activity on the airlock.

post.regular-body:
After 90 minutes of boiling I hit 1.074 and 6.5 gallons so I started the normal boil.

BT=90 EV=6.5 OG=1.074 FV=5

Ended up taking 7.5 gallons into kettle. OG of that is 1.060 and will try to boil it to 1.072+.

BV=7.5 BG=1.060
Mashed out because gravity was low, 1.078. Seemed to not work as gravity dropped to 1.068 after mash-out. Now we have 9 gallons and probably won’t spare at all.
30m into mash, 153°. Covering mash tun loosely. 152° at 45m.
15m into mash we got to 153° so I closed it for the rest of the hour.

post.photo-caption: Striked at 167° and only down to 155° after dough-in. Shouldve used Brew Pal’s 163° recommendation over iBrewMaster’s. Leaving cover off until we hit 152°.
